section.title: What is EcoBreton
section.description:
As a company committed to responsible innovation, Breton understands that sustainability must be a guiding principle, integrated into our way of thinking, creating, and acting.


It was with this perspective that, in 2016, we created EcoBreton: a program that reflects our commitment to the planet and to future generations. It reflects our way of conducting business, based on responsibility, ethics, and environmental awareness.


EcoBreton involves all stages of our chain. It begins with the careful selection of raw materials and suppliers aligned with sustainable practices. It goes through more efficient production processes with less environmental impact. It includes continuous training of our teams to strengthen the ESG culture. And it extends to concrete environmental regeneration actions, such as supporting the restoration of native biomes.


All this with a clear purpose: to leave, through our choices and actions, a Breton legacy for the next generations.

contentInfo.title: For every order, a tree is planted in the Atlantic Forest - a Breton legacy for future generations
contentInfo.description:
For every order placed at Breton, we plant a tree in the Atlantic Forest. This action takes place through our partnership with the S.O.S Atlantic Forest Foundation.

Why the Atlantic Forest?

One of Brazil's main biomes, the choice of the Atlantic Forest also has symbolic value: this is the biome that is home to more than 70% of the Brazilian population and has already lost more than 80% of its original vegetation.

Restoring this heritage is a way to generate a positive impact in the present and future, as it is also fundamental for essential services and activities such as climate regulation, water and energy supply, agriculture, fishing, and tourism.

section.title: Breton is Carbon Negative
section.description: We are the only brand in the world in the sector to achieve recognition as carbon negative for the third consecutive year.
list: Since 2020, we have offset 100% of our COÂ² emissions. And, starting in 2022, we went a step further: we began to offset more than we generate, officially becoming a Carbon Negative brand. The assessment of Breton's greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions is carried out annually by The Planet, which conducts a precise inventory of the carbon emitted by the brand, following the standards of the GHG Protocol Corporate Standard and norm 14064-1.

section.text: Breton Circular is a pioneering circular economy initiative in the luxury furniture segment.  Through an exclusive platform for reselling used Breton furniture, managed by Garimpo na Casa, pieces in good condition get a chance to be part of new stories, extending their useful life and reducing waste.

section.title: Sustainable Production Practices
section.description: We are always looking for new solutions to integrate good practices into all aspects of our business. Therefore, we present a wide range of initiatives to reduce environmental impacts throughout the entire production chain.

mediaType.title: Conscious lighting
mediaType.subtitle: Breton Care
description: To cover areas where natural light is not effective, Breton uses an LED lighting system.
The choice of LED, instead of traditional mercury vapor, goes beyond energy savings and durability.
Mercury vapor lamps have heavy metals and gases in their composition that contaminate the environment during their manufacturing and disposal.

images.title: Sustainable factory
images.description: Sustainability at the Breton factory begins with its construction project, continuing with the internal management of inputs and the final disposal of materials.

images.title: NATURAL LIGHTING
images.description: Breton has a natural lighting system that, without the aid of artificial lamps, covers almost entirely the common and productive areas of the unit.

images.title: Attention to detail
images.description: Sustainability and impact reduction are topics that directly affect our lives. An example of this is the strategically distributed integrated aspiration system throughout the factory. It is responsible for collecting wood dust and soot at the exact moment of cutting. In addition to collecting wood residue, the aspiration keeps the environment suitable for breathing and clean, increasing the quality of the workspace for the employee. All collected material is sent to a company specializing in composting solids from manufacturing processes.

images.title: Conscious Production
images.description: At Breton, every production process is designed and executed with this sustainable mission. A practical example is foam recycling. All foam scraps and leftovers generated in the factory are passed through a machine that, through a cutting and grinding process, transforms these sheets into cushion filling. This foam mix, in addition to reducing waste, gives the synthetic fiber a softness that promotes greater comfort. Sustainability and comfort translated into the product.

leftCol.title: Sustainable Input
leftCol.text: The choice of materials, inputs, and finishes is not made solely based on their final appearance and cost. Environmental impact and recycling are crucial items in decision-making. Breton currently has the largest portfolio of natural reforestation wood veneers in the national furniture market.
texts: Environmental impact and recycling are crucial items in decision-making.
Breton currently has the largest portfolio of natural reforestation wood veneers in the national furniture market.
Environmental care and responsibility extend from the purchase and handling of inputs to final disposal.
Breton works with partners for the management of each type of waste generated during furniture production.
section.title: END-TO-END RESPONSIBILITY

responsabilities.text: Breton works with specialized partners for the removal, separation, and correct disposal of paint surpluses.
The wood dust generated at Breton is treated and disposed of legally and consciously by a certified company.
These small scraps of metallic materials, such as stainless steel, aluminum, and carbon steel, are 100% recyclable. They are melted and molded into new shapes and returned to the production chain.

Chemical agents are extremely harmful to nature, which is why Breton hires specialized and certified companies that work on the correct disposal of these chemical agents, preventing them from coming into contact with the soil and nature.

As it is a very diverse material with a wide variety of finishes, the recycling of scraps is done by a company that collects, separates the pieces, and, according to each profile, correctly disposes of each type.

Even with reverse logistics for packaging, which reduces waste generation and minimizes plastic use, all material eventually needs to be discarded. And for this final disposal, Breton has serious policies for separation and recycling.

texts: Sustainability is the legacy Breton wants to offer to future generations and your family!
